p: In Tafilalet, Oujda and, North-west of Morocco, women use more phytotherapy (61–76%) than men (23–39%) [ 2, 20, 23]. This result must be explained by the fact that women are more involved in traditional knowledge of medicinal plants use and are more often at home during the hours of the surveys [ 11, 41]. The level of education is firmly correlated with the use of medicinal plants [ 11]. Moreover, older people practice phytotherapy more often compared to younger people [ 20].
